title: I know a little bit of history which I have learned from various languages and I want to publish a book on it. Can I publish? Will I get copyright issues in the future? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well I don't think I am the right person to answer this question. But I would like to answer this. Don't write just for the sake of your knowledge. If you are sure about the incidents and have a deep knowledge and the culture which made it popular. You can think of writing the incident Writing History is not everyone's cup of tea. You need to know everything. Culture, situation, people and their way of life. Simply knowing one dimension, we can not judge anything. It's depends upon you and your abilities. How do you elaborate the situation with the incident. This is my personal opinion.

If you are writing your own content, then you won’t be facing any copyright issues. If you are taking content from other sources that are copyrighted, then you might want to take their permission or give necessary citations to prevent copyright issues in the future. Consider understanding the context and making the words on your own. This way you will be able to explain your understandings in the book and at the same time prevent copyright issues. Take care of the images you use in the book as well. Even copyright laws are applicable to images as well.
